dt: {bc}to sign (something, such as a document) with one's own hand in token of consent or obligation
{bc}to pledge (a gift or contribution) by writing one's name with the amount
{bc}to sign one's name to a document
{bc}to give consent or approval to something written by signing
{bc}to set one's name to a paper in token of promise to give something (such as a sum of money)
{bc}to give something in accordance with such a promise
{bc}to enter one's name for a publication or service

dt.t: {wi}Subscribe{/wi} now and get your first issue free.
And you can listen to this show anytime by {wi}subscribing{/wi} to our podcast.

dt: {bc}to receive or have access to something (such as a periodical or service) as part of an arrangement to receive a certain number of regular deliveries or a certain period of continuous access especially by prepayment

dt.t: the number of people who currently {wi}subscribe{/wi} to the magazine/site

dt: {bc}to agree to purchase and pay for securities especially of a new offering

pt: {sc}assent{/sc} {sc}consent{/sc} {sc}accede{/sc} {sc}acquiesce{/sc} {sc}agree{/sc} {sc}subscribe{/sc} mean to concur with what has been proposed. {sc}assent{/sc} implies an act involving the understanding or judgment and applies to propositions or opinions.
{sc}consent{/sc} involves the will or feelings and indicates compliance with what is requested or desired.
{sc}accede{/sc} implies a yielding, often under pressure, of assent or consent.
{sc}acquiesce{/sc} implies tacit acceptance or forbearance of opposition.
{sc}agree{/sc} sometimes implies previous difference of opinion or attempts at persuasion.
{sc}subscribe{/sc} implies not only consent or assent but hearty approval and active support.

et: Middle English, from Latin {it}subscribere{/it}, literally, to write beneath, from {it}sub-{/it} + {it}scribere{/it} to write {ma}{mat|scribe|}{/ma}
shortdef: to sign (something, such as a document) with one's own hand in token of consent or obligation

dt: {bc}to pay money to get (a publication or service) regularly
{bc}to belong to or support (something, such as an organization) by paying money regularly
{bc}to agree with or support (an opinion, theory, etc.)

dt.t: I {it}subscribe to{/it} the idea that voting is my civic duty.
She {it}subscribes to{/it} the theory that some dinosaurs were warm-blooded and others were cold-blooded.

shortdef: to pay money to get (a publication or service) regularly
to belong to or support (something, such as an organization) by paying money regularly
to agree with or support (an opinion, theory, etc.)
